intro: Hippocrepis confusa var. banica, commonly known as the Banat orchid, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the Balkan region. It belongs to the Fabaceae family and is characterized by its striking violet-blue flowers with a distinctive yellow throat. The plant typically grows in calcareous soils and is often found in rocky or limestone-rich habitats. It is a perennial herb that produces small, pod-like fruits containing several seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
